children.value: Import the package in the root of your project somewhere and you will have access to all of the provided yup methods.
If you want to utilize the custom date validators you can import using
. Optional. Whether or not the given string is required. Default:
. Optional. Custom error message when invalid. Default:
. Optional. Custom error message when invalid. Default:
Validates a phone number. Must be 10 digits without country code, can be formatted when using string schema.
. Optional. Custom error message when invalid. Default:

import '@availity/yup';
import * as yup from 'yup';

const schema = yup.string().phone();

schema.isValid('(444) 444-4444'); // true
schema.isValid('+1 (444) 444-4444'); // true
schema.isValid('444-444-4444'); // true
schema.isValid('+1 444-444-4444'); // true
schema.isValid('444.444.4444'); // true
schema.isValid('(444) 444 4444'); // true

const schema = yup.number.phone();

schema.isValid('4444444444'); // true
schema.isValid('444 444 4444'); // true
schema.isValid('44444444445'); // false
schema.isValid('+14444444444'); // false
. optional. The format to parse the dates with.
. optional. The key for the start date. Default:
. optional. The key for the end date. Default:
. Optional. Custom error message when invalid. Default: "Date Range is invalid."
Accepts range of dates the date range can fall between.
. Optional. Custom error message when invalid. Default: "Date Range must be between XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX."
Accepts date the date range must start after.
. Optional. Custom error message when invalid. Default: "Date Range must start after XX/XX/XXXX"
Accepts date, the date range must start before.
. Optional. Custom error message when invalid. Default: "Date Range must start before XX/XX/XXXX"
